sentences: Early years =
Growing up in Eastern Kentucky, Rigsby discovered bluegrass music early on.
At age 5, Rigsby learned to sing from a 1959 tape of Ralph Stanley singing "Hills of Home" and "Little Maggie.
In 1987, Rigsby joined Charlie Sizemore's bluegrass band and stayed for two years.

When he graduated in 1990, Rigsby moved to Nashville and joined Vern Gosdin's road band.

Rigsby's first solo album A Vision, released in 1999, was a collection of bluegrass gospel music.
The album won the Association of Independent Music's Gospel Album of the Year award.

Midnight Call =
